paper_title.ja: 総合科学雑誌における不正行為論文の逐次刊行とその撤回及び背景
paper_title.en: Multiple publication and retraction of misconduct articles in science magazines

description.ja: 2000年から2001年にかけて，一流学術雑誌に掲載され続けたエレクトロニクス材料・素子分野における革新的な内容を持つ一連の20余編に及ぶ論文が，度重なる不正行為に基づくものであったとする調査結果に基づいて，2003年5月までにそのほとんどが撤回され、また、その不正行為に関係すると見られる論文に対して要注意を告知するなどの措置が取られた。対象となった論文の刊行状況ならびに撤回の経緯について述べ，不正行為に基づく論文が掲載し続けられた背景について考察する。
description.en: A series of more than 20 articles reporting cutting-edge results on research and development in the field of electronic materials and devices, which had been published in highly reputed magazines and journals during the period of 2000 to 2001, were either retracted or warned about misconduct by May 2003, after the report of investigation. The state of the publication affairs and the procedure of the retraction, together with their background in relation to the role of magazines, are described and discussed.

paper_title.ja: Bi<sub>2</sub>Sr<sub>2</sub>CaCu<sub>2</sub>O<sub>8</sub>における超伝導面にほぼ平行な磁束のクリーピング
paper_title.en: Creeping of pinned vortex lines nearly parallel to the superconducting plane of Bi<inf>2</inf>Sr<inf>2</inf>CaCu<inf>2</inf>O<inf>8</inf> in the irreversible region

description.en: The study of the irreversible motion of magnetic flux lines nearly parallel to the superconducting (SC) plane of Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8 is presented. On tilting a crystal in the magnetic field nearly parallel to the SC plane, the relaxation behavior of the pinned vortex lines is determined by the creeping of pancake vortices (PV) formed on the SC sheets. The results are interpreted in terms of the crossing lattice model with respect to the coexistence of the Josephson-like vortex and PV in a tilted magnetic field. Based on the temperature dependence of the response time, the pinning potential of the PV, which are connected to the Josephson-like vortices, is evaluated. © 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.ja: Elsevier; Physica C: Superconductivity and Its Application
publication_name.en: Physica C: Superconductivity and its Applications

paper_title.en: Creeping of pinned vortex lines nearly parallel to the superconducting plane of Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8 in the irreversible region

description.en: The study of the irreversible motion of magnetic flux lines nearly parallel to the superconducting (SC) plane of Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8 is presented. On tilting a crystal in the magnetic field nearly parallel to the SC plane, the relaxation behavior of the pinned vortex lines is determined by the creeping of pancake vortices (PV) formed on the SC sheets. The results are interpreted in terms of the crossing lattice model with respect to the coexistence of the Josephson-like vortex and PV in a tilted magnetic field. Based on the temperature dependence of the response time, the pinning potential of the PV, which are connected to the Josephson-like vortices, is evaluated. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Superconductivity of layered organic compound beta-(BDA-TTP)(2)SbF6, where BDA-TTP is 2,5-bis(1,3-dithian-2-ylidene)-1,3,4,6-tetrathiapentalene

description.en: The superconductivity (SC) of a layered organic salt beta-(BDA-TTP)(2)SbF6 with a new donor molecule centered with tetrathiapentalene (TTP) has been characterized by the temperature dependence of the upper critical field H-c2(T) and the specific heat. The SC transition behaviors observed via the resistive and magnetic susceptibility measurements are different at finite temperatures, probably due to the influence of vortex dynamics. The SC parameters including the coherence lengths are evaluated based on the H-c2(0)'s in tire magnetic fields applied parallel and perpendicular to the SC plane, in combination with the specific heat data.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: Superconductivity and magnetoresistance oscillations in weakly pressurized quasi one-dimensional superconductor (DMET-TSeF)(2)AuI2

description.en: Low-temperature magnetoresistance measurements were used to characterize the superconducting state and the electronic structure of the quasi one-dimensional salt (DMET-TSeF)(2)AuI2. The measurements revealed an essential role of small pressure created by grease molding. The small pressure suppressed the resistance jumps so that the intrinsic properties of the salt were clearly observed. The upper critical fields were determined for all three principal crystallographic directions, In contrast to strain-free samples, slightly pressurized samples show clear angle-dependent magnetoresistance oscillations related to the Fermi surface topology, demonstrating close similarity to the (TMTSF)(2)X salts.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
